title: Maple Horseradish Glazed Beets
summary: Maple Horseradish Glazed Beets might be just the side dish you are searching for. For $1.68 per serving, this recipe covers 11% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Watching your figure? This gluten free, primal, and vegetarian recipe has 228 calories, 3g of protein, and 12g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 4. A mixture of beets, maple syrup, salt, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 5 hours. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. With a spoonacular score of 33%, this dish is not so great. Try Maple Horseradish Beets for Two, Maple Horseradish Beets, and Maple Glazed Beets for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400°F.                                                                Wrap beets in foil and roast until tender, about 1 hour. When cool enough to handle, peel beets and cut into eighths, then transfer to a bowl.                                                                Melt butter with horseradish, syrup, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat. Stir in beets and boil, stirring occasionally, until liquid in skillet is reduced to about 1/4 cup and beets are coated, 4 to 5 minutes.

steps.step: Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400°F.
Wrap beets in foil and roast until tender, about 1 hour. When cool enough to handle, peel beets and cut into eighths, then transfer to a bowl.

Melt butter with horseradish, syrup, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat. Stir in beets and boil, stirring occasionally, until liquid in skillet is reduced to about 1/4 cup and beets are coated, 4 to 5 minutes.
